revised_title: Fossil Mammals of Australia: Family Macropodidae and Genera Macropus, Osphranter, Phascolagus, Sthenurus, and Protemnodon
tldr: This article discusses the fossil mammals of Australia, specifically focusing on the family Macropodidae, which includes kangaroos. The author examines the dental development and variations in the size, form, and structure of teeth in various species of kangaroos, providing insights into the evolution and classification of these extinct marsupials.
